birth_place.zh-cn: 安徽省庐州府巢县烔炀镇中李村

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物、军事人物、特工，中国人民解放军上将。早年从事中共地下工作，被称为“龙潭三杰”之一。长期负责情报工作，曾任中共中央社会部部长、中华人民共和国外交部副部长、中国人民解放军副总参谋长、中共中央调查部部长等职，被称为中共的“特务之王”。
description.en: Chinese politician, military officer, and secret agent, holding the rank of General in the People's Liberation Army. He was an early member of the CCP's underground operations and known as one of the 'Three Heroes of Longtan'. He was in charge of intelligence work for a long time, serving as Minister of the Central Social Affairs Department, Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs, Deputy Chief of the General Staff of the PLA, and Minister of the Central Investigation Department. He is known as the 'King of Spies' of the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的武装力量。
description.en: The armed forces of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军高级将领，曾任中国人民解放军总参谋长。
description.en: A senior general in the People's Liberation Army, who served as the Chief of the General Staff of the PLA.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军高级将领，曾任中国人民解放军总参谋长。
description.en: A senior general in the People's Liberation Army, who served as the Chief of the General Staff of the PLA.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军高级将领，曾任中国人民解放军总参谋长。
description.en: A senior general in the People's Liberation Army, who served as the Chief of the General Staff of the PLA.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的情报机关。
description.en: The intelligence agency of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，接替李克农担任中共中央调查部部长。
description.en: A Chinese politician who succeeded Li Kenong as the Minister of the Central Investigation Department of the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The founding and sole ruling party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 李克农的夫人。
description.en: Spouse of Li Kenong.

description.zh-cn: 李克农之子，曾任中国人民解放军总后勤部副部长，中将军衔。
description.en: Son of Li Kenong, former Deputy Director of the General Logistics Department of the PLA, with the rank of Lieutenant General.

description.zh-cn: 李克农长子，原中共中央办公厅局级领导。
description.en: Eldest son of Li Kenong, former bureau-level leader of the General Office of the CCP Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 李克农次子，原中央军委三局正师休干，总参通信部原副部长。
description.en: Second son of Li Kenong, former division-level cadre of the Third Bureau of the Central Military Commission, and former Deputy Director of the Communications Department of the General Staff.

description.zh-cn: 李克农长女，原中央党校教授、陕西省公安厅厅长。
description.en: Eldest daughter of Li Kenong, former professor at the Central Party School and director of the Shaanxi Provincial Public Security Department.

description.zh-cn: 李克农次女，中国医学科学院肿瘤医院原党委书记、副院长。
description.en: Second daughter of Li Kenong, former Party Secretary and Vice President of the Cancer Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences.

description.zh-cn: 位于芜湖的一所学校，李克农曾在此就读。
description.en: A school in Wuhu where Li Kenong studied.

description.zh-cn: 位于芜湖的一所教会学校，李克农曾在此就读。
description.en: A mission school in Wuhu where Li Kenong studied.

description.zh-cn: 指钱壮飞、李克农、胡底三人，周恩来称赞他们“龙潭三杰”的称号。
description.en: Refers to Qian Zhuangfei, Li Kenong, and Hu Di. Zhou Enlai praised them as the 'Three Heroes of Longtan'.

description.zh-cn: 中共早期特工，“龙潭三杰”之一。因截获顾顺章叛变情报，对保卫中共中央机关起了关键作用。
description.en: An early CCP secret agent, one of the 'Three Heroes of Longtan'. He played a crucial role in protecting the CCP central organs by intercepting intelligence about Gu Shunzhang's defection.

description.zh-cn: 中国作家，与李克农等组织无政府主义团体“安社”。
description.en: A Chinese writer who organized the anarchist group 'Anshe' with Li Kenong and others.

description.zh-cn: 与李克农等组织无政府主义团体“安社”。
description.en: Organized the anarchist group 'Anshe' with Li Kenong and others.

description.zh-cn: 中国作家，与李克农等组织无政府主义团体“安社”。
description.en: A Chinese writer who organized the anarchist group 'Anshe' with Li Kenong and others.

description.zh-cn: 由李克农、蒋光慈等组织的无政府主义团体。
description.en: An anarchist group organized by Li Kenong, Jiang Guangci, and others.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的创建者与执政党。
description.en: The founding and ruling party of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 国民党时期的机构，李克农曾在此卧底。
description.en: An agency during the Kuomintang era where Li Kenong worked undercover.

description.zh-cn: 国民党特务头子，曾任国民党中央组织部党务调查科科长、上海无线电管理局局长。
description.en: A Kuomintang secret service chief who served as the head of the Party Affairs Investigation Section of the KMT Central Organization Department and the director of the Shanghai Radio Administration.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期的情报和政治保卫机关。
description.en: An early intelligence and political security agency of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 中共中央政治局候补委员，中共中央特科负责人之一，1931年被捕后叛变。
description.en: An alternate member of the Politburo of the CCP Central Committee and one of the leaders of the Central Special Branch. He defected after being arrested in 1931.

description.zh-cn: 第一次国共内战时期中国共产党建立的革命根据地。
description.en: A revolutionary base area established by the Chinese Communist Party during the First Chinese Civil War.

nodes.id: 中国工农红军第一方面军

zh-cn: 中国工农红军第一方面军
en: First Front Army of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军主力部队之一。
description.en: One of the main forces of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国将领，东北军领袖，发动西安事变。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China, leader of the Northeastern Army, who initiated the Xi'an Incident.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要领导人之一。
description.en: One of the main leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军一级上将。
description.en: A General First Class of the Republic of China Army.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争时期八路军在上海设立的办事机构。
description.en: An office established by the Eighth Route Army in Shanghai during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争时期八路军在南京设立的办事机构。
description.en: An office established by the Eighth Route Army in Nanjing during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争时期中国共产党领导的主要武装力量之一。
description.en: One of the main armed forces led by the Communist Party of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党创始人及早期领导人之一，后叛离中共。
description.en: A founder and early leader of the Chinese Communist Party who later defected.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争时期八路军在桂林设立的办事机构。
description.en: An office established by the Eighth Route Army in Guilin during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的情报保卫机关。
description.en: The intelligence and security agency of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的情报机关。
description.en: The intelligence agency of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 第二次国共内战初期，由国民党、共产党和美国三方组成的军事调停机构。
description.en: A military mediation body composed of the Kuomintang, the Communist Party, and the United States at the beginning of the Second Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国开国元帅，中国共产党和中华人民共和国的领导人之一。
description.en: A founding marshal of the People's Republic of China and one of the leaders of the CCP and the PRC.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的前高级领导人，负责情报和安全工作。
description.en: A former senior leader of the CCP and the PRC, responsible for intelligence and security work.

description.zh-cn: 中国作家、翻译家，在延安整风运动中被打为“托派”，后被处决。
description.en: A Chinese writer and translator who was labeled a 'Trotskyist' during the Yan'an Rectification Movement and later executed.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国外交部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国外交部
en: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政府负责外交事务的组成部门。
description.en: The executive agency of the State Council of the PRC responsible for foreign relations.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国中央军事委员会的情报部门。
description.en: The intelligence department of the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中国人民解放军和中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Liberation Army, and the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 1962年中共中央召开的扩大的中央工作会议。
description.en: An enlarged Central Work Conference held by the CCP Central Committee in 1962.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国主席。
description.en: One of the leaders of the CCP and the PRC, who served as the President of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 位于安徽省巢湖市，是李克农的出生地。
description.en: Located in Chaohu City, Anhui Province, it is the birthplace of Li Kenong.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的首都。
description.en: The capital of the People's Republic of China.

position.en: Deputy Chief of the General Staff

description.zh-cn: 1954年10月至1962年2月，李克农担任中国人民解放军副总参谋长。
description.en: From October 1954 to February 1962, Li Kenong served as the Deputy Chief of the General Staff of the People's Liberation Army.

description.zh-cn: 在李克农担任副总参谋长期间，粟裕是其上级总参谋长。
description.en: During Li Kenong's tenure as Deputy Chief of the General Staff, Su Yu was his superior, the Chief of the General Staff.

description.zh-cn: 在李克农担任副总参谋长期间，黄克诚是其上级总参谋长。
description.en: During Li Kenong's tenure as Deputy Chief of the General Staff, Huang Kecheng was his superior, the Chief of the General Staff.

description.zh-cn: 在李克农担任副总参谋长期间，罗瑞卿是其上级总参谋长。
description.en: During Li Kenong's tenure as Deputy Chief of the General Staff, Luo Ruiqing was his superior, the Chief of the General Staff.

description.zh-cn: 1955年6月至1962年2月，李克农担任第一任中共中央调查部部长。
description.en: From June 1955 to February 1962, Li Kenong served as the first Minister of the Central Investigation Department of the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 孔原接替李克农担任中共中央调查部部长。
description.en: Kong Yuan succeeded Li Kenong as the Minister of the Central Investigation Department of the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 李克农于1926年冬加入中国共产党。
description.en: Li Kenong joined the Chinese Communist Party in the winter of 1926.

description.zh-cn: 李克农与赵瑛于1917年结婚，赵瑛于1961年去世。
description.en: Li Kenong married Zhao Ying in 1917, and she passed away in 1961.

description.zh-cn: 李克农于1962年2月9日在北京病逝，后葬于北京八宝山革命公墓。
description.en: Li Kenong died of illness in Beijing on February 9, 1962, and was later buried in the Babaoshan Revolutionary Cemetery in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 1918年，李克农与蒋光慈等组织无政府主义团体“安社”。
description.en: In 1918, Li Kenong organized the anarchist group 'Anshe' with Jiang Guangci and others.

description.zh-cn: 李克农与钱壮飞、胡底并称为“龙潭三杰”，在中共中央特科共事。
description.en: Li Kenong, along with Qian Zhuangfei and Hu Di, were known as the 'Three Heroes of Longtan' and worked together in the CCP's Central Special Branch.

description.zh-cn: 1918年，李克农与蒋光慈、李宗邺、钱杏邨等在安徽省立第五中学组织无政府主义团体“安社”。
description.en: In 1918, Li Kenong, along with Jiang Guangci, Li Zongye, and Qian Xingcun, organized the anarchist group 'Anshe' at the Anhui Provincial No. 5 Middle School.

position.zh-cn: 芜湖县党部宣传部部长
position.en: Head of the Propaganda Department of the Wuhu County Party Headquarters

description.zh-cn: 1927年3月，任国民党芜湖县党部宣传部部长。
description.en: In March 1927, he served as the Head of the Propaganda Department of the Kuomintang's Wuhu County Party Headquarters.

position.en: Chief of the Electrical Affairs Section

description.zh-cn: 1929年冬，李克农化名进入上海无线电管理局，后升任电务股股长，为中共中央特科从事秘密情报工作。
description.en: In the winter of 1929, Li Kenong infiltrated the Shanghai Radio Administration under an alias and was later promoted to Chief of the Electrical Affairs Section, carrying out secret intelligence work for the CCP's Central Special Branch.

description.zh-cn: 李克农在上海无线电管理局工作时，该局局长为徐恩曾，李克农取得了其信任。
description.en: When Li Kenong worked at the Shanghai Radio Administration, the director was Xu Enzeng, and Li gained his trust.

description.zh-cn: 李克农在上海从事地下工作时，受中共中央特科领导。
description.en: While engaged in underground work in Shanghai, Li Kenong was under the leadership of the CCP's Central Special Branch.

description.zh-cn: 1931年4月，时任中共中央政治局候补委员的顾顺章在武汉被捕后叛变，对中共中央的安全构成严重威胁。
description.en: In April 1931, Gu Shunzhang, then an alternate member of the CCP Politburo, defected after being arrested in Wuhan, posing a severe threat to the security of the CCP Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 钱壮飞获取了顾顺章叛变的情报，并设法通知李克农，使得中共中央机关得以安全转移。
description.en: Qian Zhuangfei obtained intelligence about Gu Shunzhang's defection and managed to inform Li Kenong, enabling the safe evacuation of the CCP central organs.

description.zh-cn: 李克农接到钱壮飞传递的关于顾顺章叛变的情报后，转报中共中央，使得中央机关得以安全转移。
description.en: After receiving intelligence from Qian Zhuangfei about Gu Shunzhang's defection, Li Kenong relayed it to the CCP Central Committee, enabling the safe evacuation of the central organs.

relationships.target: 中国工农红军第一方面军

position.en: Director of the Political Security Bureau

description.zh-cn: 1932年，李克农任中国工农红军第一方面军政治保卫局局长。
description.en: In 1932, Li Kenong was appointed Director of the Political Security Bureau of the First Front Army of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 李克农参加长征，负责敌情侦察和保卫中共中央机关安全的工作。
description.en: Li Kenong participated in the Long March, responsible for enemy reconnaissance and the security of the CCP Central Committee organs.

description.zh-cn: 1936年春，李克农作为中共代表在洛川与张学良达成局部停战协定。
description.en: In the spring of 1936, Li Kenong, as a CCP representative, reached a local ceasefire agreement with Zhang Xueliang in Luochuan.

description.zh-cn: 李克农在西安事变谈判和1954年日内瓦会议等多个重要场合协助周恩来工作。
description.en: Li Kenong assisted Zhou Enlai on several important occasions, including the Xi'an Incident negotiations and the 1954 Geneva Conference.

description.zh-cn: 1937年1月，李克农代表红军，在潼关与顾祝同进行停止内战的谈判。
description.en: In January 1937, Li Kenong, representing the Red Army, negotiated with Gu Zhutong in Tongguan to stop the civil war.

description.zh-cn: 1938年5月，张国焘叛逃中共后，在武汉被李克农扣留。
description.en: In May 1938, after Zhang Guotao defected from the CCP, he was detained by Li Kenong in Wuhan.

description.zh-cn: 1938年11月，李克农组建八路军驻桂林办事处并任处长。
description.en: In November 1938, Li Kenong established the Eighth Route Army Office in Guilin and served as its director.

description.zh-cn: 1947年3月起，李克农在叶剑英领导下开展情报工作。
description.en: From March 1947, Li Kenong carried out intelligence work under the leadership of Ye Jianying.

description.zh-cn: 1947年6月，李克农和康生下令将王实味秘密处死。
description.en: In June 1947, Li Kenong and Kang Sheng ordered the secret execution of Wang Shiwei.

description.zh-cn: 1947年6月，康生和李克农下令将王实味秘密处死。
description.en: In June 1947, Kang Sheng and Li Kenong ordered the secret execution of Wang Shiwei.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国外交部

description.zh-cn: 1949年底到1950年初，李克农领导破获了国民党特工密谋刺杀毛泽东的案件。
description.en: From late 1949 to early 1950, Li Kenong led the effort to foil a plot by Kuomintang agents to assassinate Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 1951年7月，李克农作为中方代表团总指挥和最高负责人，赴朝鲜参加停战谈判。
description.en: In July 1951, Li Kenong, as the commander-in-chief and top leader of the Chinese delegation, went to Korea to participate in the armistice negotiations.

description.zh-cn: 1954年4月，李克农出席日内瓦会议，协助周恩来工作。
description.en: In April 1954, Li Kenong attended the Geneva Conference, assisting Zhou Enlai.

description.zh-cn: 1962年，李克农出席了七千人大会。
description.en: In 1962, Li Kenong attended the 7000 Cadres Conference.
